title: Tempered expectations of Fed rate cut sink stocks globally
text: A strong U.S. jobs report that tempered expectations of an aggressive interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve later this month and weak economic data in Germany helped push global stock indices lower Friday after hitting record highs earlier this week.

title: Gold Futures Under Pressure After Stronger-Than-Forecast Jobs Number
text: This morning, we’re seeing a case of strong economic data actually weighing on market sentiment as a bumper jobs report dampens rate-cut expectations

title: Dow Jones Falls On Strong Job Growth In June, Samsung Profit Warning
text: The major stock indexes were broadly lower early Friday after a strong jobs report. Chip stocks weakened after Samsung's profit warning.

title: Kudlow: Jobs report shows country is in a 'very strong prosperity cycle,' but Fed should still cut
text: Larry Kudlow, director of the National Economic Council, is "very optimistic" about the health of the U.S. economy but believes the Fed should "take back the interest rate hike.

title: Wall St. slips as strong jobs data tempers bets of aggressive rate cut
text: U.S. stocks fell on Friday, retreating from record closing highs, after a strong rebound in U.S. job growth in June dashed hopes of an aggressive interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month.

title: Brent oil inches up on Iran tensions and OPEC, while U.S. crude falls
text: Brent oil ticked higher on Friday, supported by tensions over Iran and the decision by OPEC and its allies to extend a supply cut deal until next year, while U.S. benchmark crude prices fell on weak economic indicators.

title: Here's where the jobs are — in one chart
text: CNBC studied the net changes by industry for June jobs based on the data from the Labor Department.

title: Crypto Analysis Of The Best-Performing IEOs Out Of Binance Launchpad
text: Binance is actively leading the charge to facilitate the mass-market adoption of cryptocurrencies around the world and one of the ways it is achieving this goal is through its Binance Launchpad platform.

title: The Good News: The Job Market Is Solid. The Bad News: The Job Market Is Solid.
text: Friday’s numbers take some of the immediate worries off the table, but they don’t mean that all is well in the U.S. economy.

title: Kudlow says Fed should 'take back' interest-rate hike
text: White House economist Larry Kudlow told Bloomberg TV on Friday the Federal Reserve should "take back" its December interest rate hike. Commenting after the stronger-than-expected June jobs report, National Economic Council Director Kudlow said "we are still in a very strong prosperity cycle.

title: Is Trading Futures a Good Idea for a Value Investor?
text: Experienced investors are usually on an ongoing mission to find new ways to expand their portfolios, either by learning new skills that can help them trade more effectively or by investing in new assets to diversify their holdings.

title: Stocks open lower after strong jobs report saps rate-cut expectations
text: Stocks opened moderately lower Friday after a stronger-than-expected June jobs report dampened somewhat expectations for a rate cut by the Federal Reserve. The Dow Jones Industrial Average  fell 100.52 points, or 0.4%, to 26,865.48, while the S&P 500  was off 12.98 points, or 0.4%, to 2,982.84.

title: June Employment Numbers Outpace Expectations
text: Economists were expecting June nonfarm payroll data to show an increase of 165,000, jobs but the final numbers came in much better than expected.

title: Bitcoin: Is Consolidation Of Price A Good Sign?
text: The current consolidation of the Bitcoin price may last for a few weeks. I believe if one particular scenario plays out, we are likely to see an all-time high as early as the end of Q3.

title: U.S. Payrolls Rise More Than Expected in June, and the Market Is Disappointed
text: This week may have been broken up by the 4th of July holiday, but the global financial markets were open even as U.S. markets were being run by skeleton crews.

title: US job growth rebounds as economy adds 224,000 jobs in June
text: US job growth rebounded strongly in June, but moderate wage gains and mounting evidence that the economy was slowing sharply could still encourage the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates this month.

title: Gold prices plunge after jobs report produces a better-than-expected 214,000 gain in June
text: Gold futures Friday morning tumbled after a key reading of U.S. jobs came in far better than expected, sparking doubt about a price-supportive rate cut by the Federal Reserve for bullion.

title: 224,000 Jobs Added In June, But Fed Rate Cut Still Likely; Dow Jones Slips
text: A strong 224,000 job gain in June probably won't derail expectations for a Fed rate cut. Dow Jones and broader stock market futures slipped.

title: Brent inches up on Iran tensions, OPEC; U.S. oil falls on weak data
text: Brent oil ticked higher on Friday, supported by tensions over Iran and this week's decision by OPEC and its allies to extend a supply cut deal until next year, while U.S. benchmark crude prices fell on weak economic indicators.

title: Fed-sensitive 2-year Treasury yield surges after solid jobs report
text: Short-term Treasury yields rose sharply on Friday following a better-than-expected number in the nonfarm payrolls report, suggesting investors' expectations for a rate-cut as soon as July had been dealt a blow.

title: U.S. stock-index futures slip after jobs reports shows a better-than-expected 214,000 created in June
text: U.S. stock index added to modest losses Friday morning after a report on the domestic jobs market came in better than expected.

title: Stashing cash still pays, but maybe not for long
text: As the probability of a rate cut increases, banks will start to lower deposit rates offered to consumers. Goldman Sachs and Ally Financial have already done so.

title: U.S. job growth surges, but wage growth remains tepid
text: U.S. job growth rebounded strongly in June, but moderate wage gains and mounting evidence that the economy was slowing sharply could still encourage the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates this month.

title: Strong job growth is back: Payrolls jump in June well above expectations
text: Payroll growth rebounded sharply in June as the U.S. economy added 224,000 jobs and the unemployment rate rose to 3.7%.

title: World stocks cling to gains, bonds hover before U.S. payrolls
text: World stocks lingered near their 17-month highs on Friday and bonds paused after this week's rally ahead of U.S. jobs data, a gauge that could stoke or temper market expectations about aggressive policy easing by the Federal Reserve.

title: Stock Futures Lull Before June Jobs Data; Will Dow Jones Take 27,000?
text: Disney stock and Zscaler neared buy points ahead of June payrolls data Friday, as markets looked toward the early release of June payrolls data.

title: US-China M&A: Reason For Optimism
text: Despite the ongoing trade war, and short of a complete meltdown in the bilateral relationship, there's reason for optimism for U.S.-China mergers and acquisitions.

title: This year's red hot IPO market has seen more women CEOs than usual take companies public
text: The boom in initial public offerings this year has also been a boon for women chief executive officers.

title: Brent crude inches up, U.S. oil falls on weak economic data
text: U.S. benchmark crude prices fell on weak economic indicators on Friday while Brent oil ticked higher, supported by tensions over Iran and this week's decision by OPEC and its allies to extend a supply cut deal until next year.

title: US job growth seen accelerating, but a rate cut is still expected
text: U.S. job growth likely rebounded in June, with wage gains expected to pick up.

title: Oil Set For Weekly Decline As Economic Woes Eclipse OPEC Curbs
text: Oil is set for the biggest weekly decline since May as global demand concerns outweighed an OPEC+ pact to extend supply curbs into 2020.

title: Stocks And Bonds Drift Before Jobs Data; Oil Falls: Markets Wrap
text: The Stoxx Europe 600 edged lower, snapping a six-day winning streak, and the euro slipped after German factory orders came in far weaker than expected.

title: 10-year Treasury yield surges back above 2% after much stronger-than-expected jobs report
text: Treasury yields were slightly higher on Friday as investors awaited the Labor Department's June jobs report.

title: Dow futures fall 100 points after strong jobs report dampens hope of a Fed rate cut
text: U.S. stock index futures extended losses on Friday after the release of stronger jobs data dampened hope for easier Federal Reserve monetary policy.

title: China's Anbang to offload health insurance unit as government speeds up asset sales
text: China's Anbang Insurance Group said it will sell its entire stake in a health insurance unit as Beijing speeds up asset disposals at the troubled government-controlled insurance conglomerate.

title: U.S. job growth seen accelerating, rate cut still expected
text: U.S. job growth likely rebounded in June, with wage gains expected to pick up, but that would probably not be enough to discourage the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates this month amid growing evidence the economy is slowing.
